headline: Turkish Eggs (Cilbir)
description: This Turkish eggs recipe is Chef John's new favorite way to make eggs: poached eggs served over garlicky dill Greek yogurt with chili oil and butter.
name: Turkish Eggs (Cilbir)
recipeIngredient: 1 cup Greek yogurt, at room temperature
2.5 tablespoons finely chopped fresh dill, or to taste
1 tablespoon white vinegar, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Make yogurt spread: Place yogurt in a medium bowl and grate in garlic; mix to combine. Season with pepper, salt, and cayenne. Add dill and mix thoroughly. Set aside at room temperature.

Make Aleppo butter: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; heat until bubbles begin to burst. Add chili flakes, paprika, and cumin. Stir until color is uniform. Turn off heat and let spices infuse.
Make parsley and jalape√±o oil: Grind parsley and jalape√±o together in a mortar. Drizzle in olive oil and season with salt; stir to combine.

Make poached eggs: Fill a large saucepan with 2 to 3 inches of water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, add vinegar, and keep water at a gentle simmer. Crack an egg into a small bowl, then gently slip egg into water, holding the bowl just above surface of water. Repeat with remaining eggs. Cook until whites are firm and yolks have thickened but are not hard, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon, pat dry on a kitchen towel, and place onto a warm plate.

Dollop yogurt mixture onto serving plates. Use the back of a spoon to spread yogurt, carving ridges into the top to catch oil. Drizzle some jalape√±o oil. Top with eggs and 1 to 2 spoonfuls of Aleppo butter. Sprinkle sea salt on top.

review.reviewBody: I make this WAY TOO MUCH!! Thank you chef john, I bought Aleppo peppers because of this recipe and I use them a lot, and as usual your instructions are perfect. Sometimes I add cooked mushrooms and wilted spinach.
The whole family loves the recipe, my son asks for it specifically. Easy prep and beautiful presentation, thank you!

Hokie Smokes, Bullwinkle. This is delicious! I am not generally a fan of plain yogurt, but this recipe is absolutely wonderful. I made two halfs of English muffins, I should have made three. Definitely a keeper. Absolutely wonderful. Again, thank you Chef John!

Sometimes for a quick lunch, I'll make this. But I'm lazy so I dont poach the eggs, I just fry them in the Aleppo butter until the yolk is soft, but cooked. Also sometimes I make the yoghurt sauce into tzatziki sauce, which is great too. Amazing, versatile recipe

√áok lezzetli. Artƒ±k sen de bir T√ºrks√ºn. If you want your morning joe with this breakfast, I suggest you have it after the meal. In Turkish, kahvaltƒ± or "breakfast" directly translates to "before-coffee." I see a lot of people in the reviews mention using naan bread, but people in Turkey love their French Bread as an accompaniment to this dish too.
Made it on a boring Thursday afternoon
I followed the recipe step by step and the accompanying video was really useful too. Turned out lovely, really tasty - what a fab recipe! üî•
David Ireland Oh, My Stars! This is absolutely scrumptious. The Very Best egg dish I have had. A couple of pieces of sourdough rye to mop up and then plate licking for zero waste. A definite keeper.

OK this could absolutely be my new favourite egg recipe. Flavour combos in this were absolutely mind blowing! Absolutely love the contrast between the creamy yogurt, spicy butter sauce, luxurious poached egg and a jalape√±o sauce. WOW‚Ä¶ thx for sharing. This is going In the ‚Äúrecipe Bible‚Äù.
I followed the recipe exactly‚Ä¶. And my husband said it was amazing‚Ä¶ the best way he had ever eaten eggs.
Absolutely perfect recipe which easy to tailor for individual tastes. We loved these eggs!
The flavor combination was incredible. My husband and I both loved this and can't wait to make it again! I literally licked the plate clean.
I love this recipe, must have toasted bread and Turkish coffee

This was so good! I used Thai chilli flakes which are hotter, so I reduced the amount (probably a little too much actually. Maybe use a teaspoon next time.) The flavours were unreal and it was so good to try something new. I made the parsley oil as well but I didn‚Äôt have any green chilli on hand so I used a tiny clove of garlic instead. Definitely worthwhile. Awesome dish. Thanks for sharing.

I love this recipe so much! It's rare to go a week without making it, especially if I have leftover aleppo butter in the fridge. I add more salt for the yogurt spread but otherwise make it as written.
Spot on! Flatbread should be on the ingredient list because it is the perfect way to soak up the gooey goodness! My husband now calls Chef John ‚ÄúSaint John‚Äù! LOL
Delicious and so easy to make!

Followed directions, step by step. Easier than expected. My husband loved this dish. I‚Äôm 3 for 3 with the help of Chef John.
Turkish Eggs
Firehouse Chili Cornbread Casserole 
Crispy Garlic Breadcrumb Chicken
It turned out to be quite good.
Egggggcelent !!!! Very hearty and amazingly tasty !! Toned down the dill and the pepper flakes a little bit, but overall this is good and my new breakfast obsession !!!
A great and very unusual recipe, with the contrast between hot and cool working really well. I omitted the parsley and jalapeno oil due to lack of ingredients, but it was still remarkable.
Delicious, with the yoghurt that I used would add a little bit of salt into this next time.

So this is our new favorite!! Once I had only 1/2 of the yogurt dip left and I needed to use an avocado that was about to go bad, so I made the dip with half yogurt and half avocado. It was really good!

I came across Chef John's youtube video and even though it looked good, I was skeptical. I couldn't see how the eggs and yogurt could possibly taste good but tried it anyway. I substituted red pepper flakes and cooked my eggs sunny side up because that's what I had and my poached eggs are horrendous. One of very few dishes that I can say made me and my stomach happy. Absolutely wonderful and a new addition to a short list of all time favorites.
This is my husbands new favorite breakfast
So Much Flavor! Delicious.

The flavor combinations are amazing! plenty of toast is crucial for sopping up all that yogurt goodness. I've found that the secret to a good fool proof poached egg, is to rapidly stir the water into a vortex, then dump the eggs in the middle of the funnel. The spinning motion will keep the egg together while it solidifies, instead of spreading all over the pan.
Absolute yum. I‚Äôve made this twice. Used Chobani whole
This recipe was absolutely delicious. It tastes just like my memory of it when I tried it in Turkey.

Absolutely amazing. One of the best things I‚Äôve ever made, all thanks to chef John. I didn‚Äôt have any of the Aleppo pepper, so used crushed red pepper instead. It was delicious. I learned that I‚Äôm not great at poaching eggs, but all in all not bad for a first attempt.
Made it exactly as instructed. It's so marvelous and satisfying like eating a fancy restaurant food. Thank you Chef John!
I used the red oil mixture to fry the eggs instead of poaching. there was a little too much yogurt for the amount of egg, but it was delicious!
One of the best breakfast dishes I've ever had.

This was incredible! It deserves 10 stars! I made it for my Easter supper. Because of the pandemic, I couldn‚Äôt go to the store to get all of the ingredients. I improvised as follows: since I didn‚Äôt have fresh dill or Aleppo pepper,? I ground up dill seeds with sea salt, crushed red pepper flakes and tarragon.?? For my flavored butter, I cooked up some Chorizo sausage then added butter, cumin, smoked paprika and fresh asparagus spears to the chorizo drippings. I didn‚Äôt have fresh jalape√±os, so I ground up a little fresh pablamo pepper with the salt and olive oil instead. I put the chorizo around the yogurt. Mmmmm! Chef John was not lying...you need plenty of toastbto get every last drop! The sweet red pepper made a very pleasing contrast to the spicy bites. I can‚Äôt handle a lot of spice, so the avocado also helped calm down the heat for me. I paired it with a lovely glass of white wine.

I made an account just to rate this recipe. 

I've never considered having eggs and yogurt together, but now that I have I'm hooked! The first time I made it I made it as directed and it was delicious. The last five or so times I've gotten a little lazy and instead of making the infused butter I'll just add the spices to the yogurt, and I've sometimes skipped the jalapeno/parsley blend and no matter what I do it's always great!
Really lovely, I added tarragon to the yogurt as well, it was so yummy
Made without the optional parsley and jalapeno oil, and just used regular crushed red pepper. Excellent. I made sure to warm the plate before assembly and made naan for dipping.
Was easy to make and came out great.
Simply amazing flavors! My new favorite breakfast!

Didn't have fresh garlic- the pungency of fresh garlic (rather than powdered or pre-chopped) would have made this even better. Worth it to use Aleppo peppers- find them at your local Mediterranean store. Till next time!

Substituted red pepper flakes for the Aleppo. My wife finished hers before I could sit down! Very tasty!
Thanks Chef John!
I used pita bread as Chef John commanded.

This might be the best thing I have ever made. I had all the ingredients, including Aleppo pepper ,so it was a no brainer when I saw this video . I absolutely demolished the plate. WOW is this good. Thank you Chef John !!
I love this recipe! I've made this several times and it is amazing every time.

This is really outstanding, and I think both oils are worthwhile. My only note would be to leave plating until the eggs are cooked and draining on paper towel--otherwise the yogurt and oils kind of coalesce into one circular blob on the plate. Having everything at room temp is pretty crucial to get the flavors to meld, and lines up with how this dish would likely be served traditionally.

It was very mildly spicy, not overly so. I thought I had let the yogurt go to room temp but the dish still seemed like it had gotten cold. Next time I would try warming it. I also might go with just the red oil, the green didn't seem to add much.
